body.name: Natracare Non-Applicator 100% Organic Cotton Tampons, Super, Totally Chlorine Free, Biodegradable and Compostable (12 Pack, 240 Tampons Total)

climatePledgeFriendly.details: Compact by Design (Certified by Amazon) products remove excess air and water, which reduces the carbon footprint of shipping and packaging. MADE SAFE certifies products made without known toxic chemicals, by prohibiting substances that harm human health or the environment.

body.description: Healthier by nature. 100% Cotton. Certified organic. Non-chlorine bleached. Why organic tampons? In 1989, Natracare was developed as a direct response to health and environmental concerns about dioxin pollution by chlorine bleaching, the use of rayon in tampons, and the extensive use of pesticides on conventionally grown cotton. For over 15 years, Natracare has been trusted by women who see the good sense in making a natural choice in tampons, pads, panty liners and feminine wipes for their monthly cycle. It makes sense to choose a tampon that is made from only certified organic cotton to avoid unnecessary exposure to chemical residuals and synthetics. Natracare Organic cotton tampons and chemical free pads are high quality products made from only pure and natural materials that are not chlorine bleached and are free of rayon, plastics and synthetic materials. Made in Germany.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2014
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Tampons Out There, Hands Down!
reviews.reviewText: Before I got any further, I have no clue why it took me so long to start using these natural tampons. A few friends have been recommending them to me for years but I thought most of what they bragged about was advertising. Really, these are the best tampons around, especially for girls like me who have a very heavy flow. They last for hours, are comfortable, and I have had less cramps and leaks since switching over to Natracare. I truly believe that the chemicals and synthetic items used in Tampax and other brands are now designed to make us use more and buy other products. I also LOVE that they are so tiny. No more carrying a giant purse during that time of the month to carry tampons for the day, or dragging a purse with me while walking. These are tiny enough to easily fit 2 of these tampons in a jean pocket while you are on the go. They are truly are a girl's best friend! While they seem pricey at first glance, they are better in the long run since you use less product and they are much easier to manage.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Applicator Free FTW
reviews.reviewText: Though NASA engineers originally (and incorrectly) estimated that Sally Ride, the first American woman in space, might need 100 tampons for a seven day mission, this supply would suffice for a much longer trip. Fortunately for us, they're also not all tied together in a nice tampon bouquet, but I guess you could do that at home too. The quality is exactly the same as all the other natracare tampons I've purchased at my local co-op. The boxes of 20 each arrived in fine condition packed within a larger box. This supply will last me longer than a year, is significantly more convenient than going to the store every month, and is a better financial deal. Also - I would use a menstrual cup but haven't found a model more comfortable and convenient than tampons but if I had I'd probably be doing that instead (cotton is hard on the environment).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Absorbent, natural, excellent product.
reviews.reviewText: These do exactly what they're supposed to, and do it well, without damaging your body.Would earn another star if Naturacare would use a compostable plastic in which to wrap the individual tampons!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If the quality holds up, I'll be buying these indefinitely
reviews.reviewText: I bought this product last year in preparation for a remote assignment. With regular monthly use, this product lasted me well over a year.I appreciate the ethos of this company and the material used. Hopefully, this company stays true to its production, material sourcing, and organic certification.I don't share the same frustrations with other customers regarding the packaging and application. I appreciate the compact size, it made the product easy to store, carry, and pack for hikes/day trips. I never lost/wasted the product due to the tab opening. If there was a time when I "struggled" with the packaging, I took a deep breath and pulled the little plastic flap a little harder.I'm looking forward to my next year supply, it will be well utilized treasured due to my new remote location.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Individual wrapping makes keeping them on hand easy
reviews.reviewText: The small size of these tampons without the applicator makes keeping a few on hand easy where ever you a are. A few in your pocket, one in your change purse, the glove box, etc. I tried keeping full size tampons on hand, but the cardboard applicator always ends up getting crushed, and the body of the tampon frays to the point of no longer being usable. I've found these in my pants pockets after they've come through the washer and the tampon was still as good as new.Other reviewers have voiced complaints about these not inserting easily, but I've found just the opposite. Most tampons are loose and fray easily, and I've had trouble inserting those even with an applicator. These are densely packed, and stay smooth all the way in.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Eco friendly awesome
reviews.reviewText: In my opinion all women should purchase these if they use tampons. Eco friendly minimal. Love!

reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Most expensive tampons ever
reviews.reviewText: Paid over $50 for this. Was supposed to receive 12 boxes of 20 tampons, recorded 1 box of 20.

reviews.reviewText: When you "subscribe and save" to more items and buy in bulk, the price is more competitive. Using these tampons prevents irritation that can occur from other products that are treated with chemicals.
